remarks.para: May be inoperative provided spar valve is verified to be operative once each flight day.

placard.para: Placard affected light "LIGHT INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Operation of the Spar Valve can be verified without gaining access to the valve as follows:

numlitem.para: Start affected engine(s) per standard procedures.
Open applicable FUEL COND CONTROL circuit breaker (left 6C1, right 6C2) on panel P6.
Move FUEL CONTROL switch on control stand to CUTOFF position.
Engine shutdown indicates proper operation of the Spar Valve. (Shutdown should occur in approximately 40 sec.)
Close previously opened FUEL CONTROL circuit breaker on P6 panel.

maintenance.para: Spar Valve check without running engine:

warning.para: REFER TO MAINTENANCE MANUAL 32-00-15 FOR LOCK INSTALLATION PROCEDURE. RAPID ACTION OF DOORS MAY CAUSE INJURY OR DAMAGE IF LOCKS ARE NOT PROPERLY INSTALLED.

numlitem.para: Open applicable left or right main gear door and install door lock.
Depressurize right and center hydraulic systems.
Open ALT TE FLAPS circuit breaker (6D23) on main power distribution panel P6 to deactivate secondary power source to flaps.
Gain access to the applicable spar valve.
For left engine spar valve, open access door 551BB.
For right engine spar valve, open access door 651BB.
Open applicable FUEL COND CONTROL circuit breaker (left 6C1, right 6C2) on panel P6.
With ground observer viewing, move the fuel control switch to the RUN position. Verify movement of the manual override lever.
Repeat several times to verify proper valve operation.
